result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) - MANITOWOC COUNTY [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs)-MANITOWOC COUNTY [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) - MANITOWOC COUNTY [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs)-MANITOWOC COUNTY [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Nicholas R. ROEDELL was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) - MANITOWOC COUNTY [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.
Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.
Reminder Notice - Final Notice

Letter from Nicholas Roedell
Letter to Nicholas Roedell
Reminder notice indicating balance of $56.00 due delivered to defendant at the Manitowoc County Jail.

Order Regarding Bail Forfeiture and Payment of Costs.
It is hereby ordered that the order forfeiting bail in 14 CF 38 and 13 CM 374 be vacated.  It is further ordered that cash bail be applied to the court costs in cases 14 CF 38, 13 CM 221 and 13 CM 251 and that remaining balances of cash bail be returned to the individual who posted the cash bail.

This is a motion hearing regarding the forfeiture of defendant's cash bail.  Counsel argue.  Defense asks for more time to present some medical information.  
Motion hearing reset to 07-02-14 at 3:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Motion hearing is set for 06-25-14 at 10:00 a.m.
Letter from ADA Vendetti in response to motion to vacate judgment of bail forfeiture.
Motion to Vacate Judgment of Bail Forfeiture.
Amended Consolidated Information adding count 5, misdemeanor bail jumping, consolidated from Brown County case no: 13 CM 1828.

Defendant in custody.
The State files an Application for Consolidation, Consent to Consolidate and Order for Consolidate with the court regarding Brown County case no: 13 CM 1828, a charge of bail jumping.  The agreement is for this charge to be consolidated with this case and to be dismissed and read in.  The State will file the Amended Information including the consolidated Brown County charge.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1 of 14 CF38, OWI  4th offense.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2, 3 and 4, prohibited BAC, bail jumping and OAR along with count 5 which is the consolidated bail jumping charge from Brown County case no: 13 CM 1828.  Motion granted.
The defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for two hundred fifty (250) days, under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.
Defendant has credit for 65 days.
$2,100.00 fine ($700 X 3) fine and costs imposed, total of $3,670.00.  $1,250.00 cash bail from 13 CM 510 applied.  $2,420.00 balance of fine and costs are due on 01-19-2015 or 48 days county jail for failure to pay.
Thirty-six (36) month DL revocation and Ignition Interlock is ordered.
Alcohol assessment ordered.
Defendant is also ordered to submit to a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Application for Consolidation from Brown County to Manitowoc County.
Consent to Consolidation.
Order for Consolidation from Brown County to Manitowoc County.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Alcohol assessment.
Minutes.
Copy of judgment of conviction mailed to Brown County District Attorney's office.

The matter is continued for a status conference on 06-20-14 at 2:00 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash with the conditions that he not operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed and that he maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
